post_text: June 9, 2019 at 10:28 PM#1I made this Macro set that separates each instance into it's own group."Start Unfold" Sets Variables For start group. I should use a variable for the first line, but I normally start at 600 for the Original group "The Whole thing"CodeSetUserVar $unfold = (First Group with plenty of empty Cells)Store Group $unfold /o;  Label Group $unfold "The Whole thing"SetUserVar $unfold = 601SetUserVar $ints =1Macro Unfold"Unfold"CodeGroup "The Whole Thing"Store Group $unfoldOff Fixture *. $intsStore Group $unfold /r;ClearMacro "Check unfold""Check unfold" I would prefer the fixture name followed by the instance rather than the "Instance.1"CodeGroup $unfold[$selectedfixturescount >= 1]  AddUserVar $Unfold =1;  AddUserVar $ints =1;  Macro Unfold[$selectedfixturescount == 0]  Label Group 601  Thru $Unfold Instance.1;  Delete Group $unfold;  SetUserVar $unfold =;  SetUserVar $ints =My head was exploding trying to think of how this was going to work but I it does? The thing throwing me off is "Off Fixture" "Store /r" Stores the fixture that I offed.Written on MA2OnPC 3.3.4.3
